description: From French heptaméride, from Ancient Greek ἑπτά (heptá, “seven”) + French méride (compare meridian).

entries.meaning: A thing having seven parts or divisions.
examples: The Greeks had Seven Wise Men and Seven Sleepers, and the Pythagoreans saw magic in all the heptamerides.
The residue remaining after the separation of the heptameride is colourless and very viscous; there appears little prospect of isolating higher polymerides [...]

entries.meaning: (music, obsolete) An interval of pitch equal to 1/7 of a meride, or 1/301 of an octave.
